creator: Bare Conductive
title: How to Make an Interactive Sound Wave Print
description: This project creates an interactive sound wave print within a picture frame. Touching the print through the glass will play the song represented by the sound wave image. Printed sensors behind the print act as a proximity sensor, connected to a Touch Board and speaker.
steps: Create a sound wave print of your chosen song using an online tool and print it on card stock.
Upload the Proximity_MP3 code to the Touch Board using the Arduino IDE. Also, upload your song named TRACK000.mp3 to the SD card.
Prepare the Printed Sensors by cutting away part of the sensor to create a reversed L-shape, ensuring an access node is available for connection.
Assemble the frame by placing the sound wave print inside, followed by the Printed Sensor behind it. Secure the frame backing and bend the sensor down, adhering it with tape.
Attach the Touch Board to the back of the frame, ensuring electrode E0 lies over the access node of the Printed Sensor. Mask unused electrodes to avoid interference.
Cold solder electrode E0 to the Printed Sensor using Electric Paint.
Securely attach the speaker and connect the Touch Board to a power source.
Touch the sound wave print to play the song. Adjust sensor thresholds if needed.
